meanings.definition: To score more points than someone else in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: In the basketball game, our team managed to outscore the opponents by ten points.
meanings.sent2: The soccer team worked hard to outsore their rivals and win the championship.
meanings.sent3: During the spelling bee, the clever student found a way to outscore everyone by using tricky words.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outscore her own record in the race was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The young chess player's strategy to outscore the experienced opponent was impressive.

meanings.sent1: The new video game is challenging, but I believe I can outscore my friends with practice.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outscore her classmates in math tests.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outscore the others in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outscore his own expectations motivates him to keep improving.
meanings.sent5: The artist's latest painting seemed to outscore all her previous works in terms of creativity.
